commentary.revenue_performance: Consolidated revenue grew by 7% in INR terms. India FMCG business volume grew by 6%. Rural was outperforming urban.
commentary.profitability: Gross margins saw a healthy expansion of 310 bps due to material deflation. Consolidated OPM (adjusted for legal costs) improved by 120 bps. A&P investments increased by 36%.
commentary.business_outlook: Management is cautiously optimistic due to improvement in volume growth. The goal is to reach a run rate of Rs 500 crores from Foods including Badshah.
commentary.key_challenges: Healthcare portfolio growth was muted due to **delayed winters**. The legal cost provision (around Rs 20 crores per quarter) remains a recurring impact on the P&L.
commentary.strategic_initiatives: Badshah growth sharply accelerated to 33%. Dabur approved a Rs 135 crores capex for a **Greenfield plant in South India**. Dabur Red volume growth (5%) was significantly ahead of competitors (~2%).
commentary.market_conditions: The gap between urban and rural growth was reducing (to 200 bps). Commodity prices were benign, leading to deflationary benefits.
